name: "The Dresden Files" - "Second City" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Lt. Murphy

	Murphy's dad came to Chicago in part to complain about her relationship with Dresden. Jim Murphy was a retired police officer in his own right.

questions.text: What were Harry and Murphy doing in their first scene?
questions.explanation:
Drinking shots.

	She was complaining about a muckraking journalist. After the complaining, she mentioned that people were starting to talk about the reports she filed in cases they worked together.

questions.text: How was the reformed gang member murdered?
questions.explanation:
Drowned.

	It was the middle of winter in Chicago, and miles from the river when the man was murdered. Police were stumped at how he could be drowned in the middle of the street with no witnesses. He had been a Russian gang-banger but had gotten out about a decade earlier.

questions.text: Dresden kissed Murphy while investigating the case.
questions.explanation:
True.

	He asked her to slap him and she refused. So he kissed her, after which she slapped him. He needed an emotional peak to keep tracking the killer.

questions.text: Dresden was shot while fighting with the killer.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Murphy shot the suspect several times as he ran away from his apartment. The suspect fought with both Murphy and Dresden, but he didn't shoot at either of them.

questions.text: Who was arrested on suspicion of being the murderer?
questions.explanation:
Joe Murphy.

	A nitro pill was found at the scene where the killer was living. The same pills were prescribed to Joe Murphy and were seen by Det. Sid Kirmani a few days earlier. He was released when he had evidence he wasn't in the state at the time of the murders, and the pill wasn't one of his.

questions.text: Who was writing a book about a hero cop?
questions.explanation:
D.W. Herrick

	He was following around Sgt. Darren Munzer and working on a book about the daring exploits of a man who seemed to defy death a lot. By the end of the episode, the writer decided not to publish the book given the outcome of the episode.

questions.text: All of the victims were branded.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The brand was what was transferring the "second chance" at life to Sgt. Munzer. He used various mystical drawings, overlaid to make the unique brand. He would brand each victim, and they would die in the way they nearly did before getting a second chance at life.

questions.text: How much per day did Harry get paid for consulting work?
questions.explanation:
$500.

	He got a $500 a day salary, with a two day minimum commitment. He rarely worked more than the two day minimum on a case due to his wizard powers helping him solve cases. Most of his cases were with Chicago Police Department.

questions.text: What happened to Munzer after the police arrived?
questions.explanation:
He was arrested.

	Dresden used the brand to transfer Joe's second chance back to him after he had apparently died. Murphy was about to shoot Munzer, when she saw that her dad was alive. All the while Munzer was held at gunpoint and eventually arrested. He was sentenced to serve life in prison.
